page.title: 05SELHURST PARK
page.content: A well fenced and protected farm estate. The farm buildings and later the house, are found down a long drive with a row of sweet chestnut trees on either side. There are also many ash, beech and mature hawthorn trees on the estate. The estate consists of 2500 acres. Grown on the estate are wheat, oats, barley and fodder beet and normally hay and silage. In 1985 however, the bad summer prevented all haymaking on this estate. The cattle are Friesians (dairy) and Limousins (beef) and sheep (Dorset/Mule cross). The pheasant shooting is good.
